H0.text: Camouflage is the adaptation that certain animals use to become less visible to predators and prey.

H1.text: Skeletons are the adaptation that certain animals use to become less visible to predators and prey.

H2.text: Speed is the adaptation certain animals use to become less visible to predators and prey.

H3.text: Insulation is the adaptation that certain animals use to become less visible to predators and prey.

A4.text: The coloration of these insects evolved between 1860 and 1940 to match the changing colour of the tree trunks on which they rest, from pale and mottled to almost black in polluted areas.

A5.text: Experimental evidence that camouflage helps prey avoid being detected by predators was first provided in 2016, when groundâ€‘nesting birds (plovers and coursers) were shown to survive according to how well their egg contrast matched the local environment.
